cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, forecast to turn northeast on Friday and pass southeast of New England toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina Outer Banks (around Cape Lookout–Cape Hatteras)

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch (south of port – Woods Hole to Sagamore Beach, MA and the islands)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, including Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard
weather_observation.warning_coast: None north of Virginia; hurricane warnings confined to SC–NC coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern New England coastline (Cape Cod and Islands) northward toward the Gulf of Maine
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northeast winds Friday night–Saturday could reach 30–40 mph, with low (7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–2 ft possible along Boston Harbor during Saturday high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible, locally higher toward Cape Cod; flooding risk low to moderate
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Massachusetts coastline beginning Friday
